sections.title: What is Cryptocurrency?
sections.content: Cryptocurrency is a type of digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security. It is decentralized and based on blockchain technology.

subsections.title: Decentralization
subsections.content: Decentralization refers to the distribution of authority, control, or power away from a central authority.

subsections.title: Blockchain Technology
subsections.content: Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology that ensures the integrity of data by linking blocks of transactions.

list.name: Bitcoin
list.description: The first and most well-known cryptocurrency, created in 2009.

list.name: Ethereum
list.description: A decentralized platform that enables smart contracts and decentralized applications.
